title: Ticket #6790: Submit object in python bindings needs a spool flag
description:
The Submit object in the python bindings has no support for spooling job files to the schedd. The old submit() function in the Schedd object does have a spool flag. The Schedd object already has spool() and retrieve() methods for doing the transfers of the job input and output sandboxes.

You can make spooling of job files work with the the Submit object today by manually setting several attributes in the job ads. Here's an example: 

#!/usr/bin/python

import htcondor
import sys, os

os.environ['X509_USER_PROXY'] = '/home/dcameron/dev/aCT/proxies/proxiesid2'
coll = htcondor.Collector('ce513.cern.ch:9619')
sch = coll.locate(htcondor.DaemonTypes.Schedd)
schedd = htcondor.Schedd(sch)

# Including paths in Output or Error requires some extra changes
cad = {"Cmd": "/bin/ls",
      "Output": "job.$(ClusterId).$(ProcId).out",
      "Error": "job.$(ClusterId).$(ProcId).err",
      "Iwd": "/tmp/output",
      "+JobStatus": "5",
      "+HoldReason": "\"Spooling input data files\"",
      "+HoldReasonCode": "16",
      "+LeaveJobInQueue": "JobStatus == 4 && (CompletionDate =?= undefined || CompletionDate == 0 || ((time() - CompletionDate) < 864000))",
      "UserLog": "/tmp/output/job.$(ClusterId).$(ProcId).log"}

sub = htcondor.Submit(cad)
ad_list = []

with schedd.transaction() as txn:
   jobid = sub.queue(txn, ad_results=ad_list)

for ad in ad_list:
   ad["ClusterId"]=jobid

schedd.spool(ad_list)

print (jobid)

Note: If you want the output and error filenames to contain any path information, then you also need to set TransferOutputRemaps.
